title: College hockey: Merrimack sends St. Lawrence to first loss of year
text:
A A 
NORTH ANDOVER, Mass. — The St. Lawrence hockey team will have to settle for a weekend split on the road against Hockey East opponents. 
A night after rallying for an overtime victory at New Hampshire, the No. 19-ranked Saints were defeated by Merrimack, 3-1 on Saturday in a nonconference game at Lawler Rink. 
St. Lawrence (3-1) yielded the first two goals of the game against the Warriors en route to being dealt its first loss of the season. 
Brian Christie and Brett Seney each scored a goal in the second period to pace Merrimack (2-0), which completed a weekend sweep of ECAC Hockey teams, including a 7-1 victory over Clarkson on Friday night. 
“Merrimack was just what I expected them to be,” St. Lawrence coach Greg Carvel said. “They are a team that can frustrate you. They play real well positionally. Tonight we wanted the game to be easier than it really was and they play fast and just chip pucks in and make you work. 
“For portions of the game I think they outworked us.” 
Goalie Collin Delia stopped 21 of 22 shots faced for Merrimack. 
Christie scored the game’s first goal two minutes, 53 seconds into the second period and Seney followed with the eventual deciding goal at 16:02 of the period. 
The Saints drew within 2-1 on freshman Michael Ederer’s first collegiate goal 7:56 into the third period, with Drew Smolcynski and Nolan Gluchowski assisting. 
But the Warriors would build another two-goal lead on Chris LeBlanc’s tally with 2:15 left in regulation. 
“It wasn’t until we were down 2-0 that we realized how hard we had to work,” Carvel said. “We came back and had some chances. We had a power play and didn’t score and then we hurt ourselves with a couple of untimely penalties. 
“I give them a lot of credit, they were easily the best team we have seen.” 
Kyle Hayton made 23 saves on 26 shots faced for St. Lawrence. Both teams went scoreless on the power play, with the Saints faring 0-for-4 and Merrimack 0-for-5.
